result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha E. Grulkowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 
1:39pm
INCLUDES 15CF419, 15CF918, 15CF935, and 15CF1024
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer; Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty John Wallace
Date and time set for sentencing hearing

State says was originally set for argued sentencing and now will have joint recommendation
Atty Wallace in agreement with proceeding with joint recommendation
COURT notes both parites have received PSI and are not objecting to PSI findings
PSI to be kept by both parties in confidential matter
VRCW.
Atty Wallace makes statement prior to sentencing


COURT ORDERS: 15CF419: Ct. 1 Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC, Ct. 2 Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC, and Ct. 3 Burglary-building or dwelling, PTAC- each count 7 and a half years WSPS: 2 and a half years IC, 5 years ES. 15CF918 Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine- repeater- 3 and a half years WSPS: 1 and a half years IC, 2 years ES, concurrent to all other sentencing. CONDITONS of ES: Complete any assessment, counseling, or treatment deemed necessary by agent, includes all follow up for AODA assessment and drug addiction issues. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, with random testing to check for compliance. Complete mental health evaluation and all recommended follow up. Enroll and complete LEAP parenting programming. No contact with co-defendants: J.L., J.G., and D.W. No contact with victims- M.G., D.M., A.W., D.M., D.S., and M.S. Pay back restitution that is joint and several to victims- A.W. of $18,455.00 and D.M. of $9,174.28. Initially paid at 25% of prison wages and remaining balance due then as payments on ES. 
Pay CC. Pay DNA sample and surcharge. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Credit for 143 days granted for all 4 sentences. Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Programming and Substance Abuse Programming. 

Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Prison. 

Adj: 2:05pm

from Br. 1 JA to Atty John Wallace and ADA Lisa Gramer 
Includes 15CF419, 15CF918, 15CF935, and 15CF1024
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

INCLUDES 15CF419, 15CF918, 15CF935, and 15CF1024

PLEA:

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Britney
Case Called: 9:55 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig. Defendant appears in person without counsel. Date & time set for Preliminary Hearing. State notes Attorney Goetz has recently been appointed as attorney but does not appear today. Defendant has not had contact with Attorney Goetz at this time. Court questions defendant re: time limits for preliminary hearing. Defendant wishes to waive time limits.
COURT waives time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Adjourned Preliminary Hearing to be set with Br.1 JA at CC- 06/01/15 at 1:00 p.m. in Br.1 office. 
Adj: 9:56 a.m. 
C: Br.1

Pre-trial conference on May 19, 2015 at 01:50 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on May 26, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2015 at 08:50 am.

No contact with victim(s):  D.M., M.G., A.W., D.M., D.S., M.S. and co-defts, J.L., D.W., J.L.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Absolute sobriety (alcohol/drugs) or unless valid prescription for medications.
